intro: Chorizema angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed chorizema, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Leguminosae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces slender, straight pods that contain seeds. Chorizema angustifolium is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in full sun.
